intro: Franseria andina, commonly known as the Andean franseria, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, typically during the cooler months. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires a cool, moist environment to flourish. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
